item.title: 澳大利亚上市公司 Xero 将以超过 25 亿美元的价格收购金融科技公司 Melio
item.description: 澳大利亚上市公司 Xero 周三表示，将以 25 亿美元的预付款收购总部位于美国的金融科技公司 Melio。【原文：Australia-listed Xero said on Wednesday it would buy U.S.-headquartered fintech firm Melio for an upfront consideration of $2.5 billion.】

item.title: 网络安全服务需求强劲，黑莓上调年度收入预期
item.description: 周二，加拿大黑莓公司（BlackBerry）上调了年度营收预期，预计在网络犯罪日益猖獗的情况下，对其网络安全服务的需求将保持稳定。【原文：Canada's BlackBerry raised its annual revenue forecast on Tuesday, anticipating steady demand for its cybersecurity services amid growing online crimes, sending the company's U.S.-listed shares up 6% after the bell.】

item.title: 交易日：停战引发全球股市震荡
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 帕克兰公司股东投票赞成 Sunoco 公司以 91 亿美元收购帕克兰公司
item.description: 帕克兰公司（Parkland Corp）股东周二投票赞成以 91 亿美元的价格收购总部位于美国的 Sunoco .【原文：Parkland Corp shareholders on Tuesday voted in favor of a $9.1 billion deal to be acquired by U.S.-based Sunoco .】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，塔吉特探索工厂直接发货模式
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，塔吉特正在探索将产品从工厂直接送到顾客家中，类似于中国电商竞争对手特卖和申银万国。【原文：Target is exploring the delivery of products directly to customers' homes from factories, similar to the Chinese e-commerce rivals Temu and Shein, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 关税不确定性导致美国第一季度外国直接投资大幅下降
item.description: 美国商务部周二表示，第一季度对美国的外国直接投资从2024年第四季度下调后的799亿美元大幅下降至528亿美元，这一下降与唐纳德-特朗普总统关税计划带来的高度商业不确定性相吻合。【原文：Foreign direct investment into the U.S. fell sharply in the first quarter to $52.8 billion from a downwardly revised $79.9 billion in the fourth quarter of 2024, the Commerce Department said on Tuesday, a drop that coincided with high business uncertainty over President Donald Trump's tariff plans.】

item.title: 联邦快递削减成本，季度利润超过华尔街目标
item.description: 联邦快递公布的季度利润好于预期，原因是成本削减和出口量增加推高了营业利润率。【原文：FedEx reported better-than-expected quarterly profit, after cost cuts and improved export volumes pushed operating margins higher, and signaled caution ahead with a forecast for the current quarter that was short of analysts' target.】

item.title: 美国债券市场为下半年国债供应激增做好准备
item.description: 顶级利率策略师周二表示，一旦立法者解决了迫在眉睫的债务上限问题（可能是永久性的），今年下半年债券市场将迎来多达 1 万亿美元的额外美国国债供应。【原文：The bond market is bracing for up to $1 trillion of additional U.S. Treasuries supply in the second half of the year once lawmakers address the looming debt ceiling problem, possibly permanently, top rates strategists said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 纳斯达克 100 指数创下自 2 月份以来的首个收盘纪录新高
item.description: 纳斯达克 100 指数周二创下 2 月份以来的首个收盘纪录新高，从近几个月来因担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收全球关税而造成的严重亏损中反弹。【原文：The Nasdaq 100 notched a record high close on Tuesday for the first time since February, rebounding from deep losses in recent months related to worries about U.S. President Donald Trump's global tariffs.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔：通胀将上升，可能会有一定的持续性
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）周二在讲话中表示，尽管迄今为止美联储在实现 2% 通胀率方面取得了所谓的 "逐步、尽管不均衡 "的进展，但他并不急于降息。【原文：Higher import levies will put upward pressure on prices that may not prove temporary, Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr said on Tuesday in remarks that suggest he is in no rush to cut interest rates despite what he called "gradual, albeit uneven" progress toward 2% inflation to date.】

item.title: 投资团体呼吁美国税收法案豁免被动收入
item.description: 代表基金经理、风险投资和房地产等行业的六个投资团体就目前正在辩论的税收和支出法案致信参议院的两位共和党人，要求被动投资免受法案中针对外国投资者的条款的限制。【原文：Six investment groups representing sectors including fund managers, venture capital and real estate in a letter to two Senate Republicans over the tax and spending bill now under debate asked that passive investments be exempt from a provision of the bill that targets foreign investors.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯称目前有必要采取适度限制性货币政策
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周二表示，货币政策正处于正确的位置。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said Tuesday monetary policy is in the right place.】

item.title: 特朗普称中国可继续从伊朗购买石油
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二表示，在美国轰炸欧佩克成员国伊朗的核设施之后，中国可以继续从伊朗购买石油，并希望中国也能从美国购买 "大量 "石油。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that China can continue to purchase oil from Iranafter the U.S. bombed the OPEC member's nuclear facilities and hoped that China would also buy "plenty" of it from the United States.】

item.title: 加纳可可种植者对 2025/2026 可可种植季的丰收持乐观态度
item.description: 世界第二大可可生产国加纳的可可种植者预计，在即将到来的 2025/2026 可可种植季，由于开花和豆荚发育情况改善，可可将获得大丰收。【原文：Cocoa farmers in the world's second-biggest producer Ghana are expecting a bumper harvest for the upcoming 2025/2026 season, buoyed by improved flowering and pod development, even as they grapple with persistent challenges in input supplies and erratic weather.】

item.title: 黄金储备局要求澄清保护 Citgo 的美国许可证问题
item.description: Gold Reserve 公司周二表示，该公司已向特拉华州一家法院提出紧急请求，要求澄清美国财政部上周延长对委内瑞拉所有的美国炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 的保护的许可，即使是在法院组织拍卖以支付债权人的情况下。【原文：Gold Reserve has filed an emergency request with a court in Delaware asking for clarification about a license by the U.S. Treasury Department that last week extended its protection over Venezuela-owned U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum even amid a court-organized auction to pay creditors, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯认为关税和不确定性将导致今年经济增长放缓、通胀上升
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）预计，今年经济增长将放缓，通胀率将上升，这在很大程度上是由于贸易关税的影响。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams expects slower growth and higher inflation this year due in large part to trade tariffs, in comments that gave little in the way of guidance for what’s next for central bank interest rate policy.】

item.title: 精神航空敦促美国拒绝与捷蓝航空和美联航合作
item.description: 廉价航空公司精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周二敦促交通部拒绝捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）和美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）的合作建议，称这是反竞争的，将促使大型航空公司寻求类似的合作。【原文：Budget airline Spirit Airlines on Tuesday urged the Transportation Department to reject a proposed JetBlue Airways and United Airlines partnership, saying it was anticompetitive and will prompt large carriers to pursue similar deals.】

item.title: ISS 建议反对 Shari Redstone 连任派拉蒙董事会成员
item.description: 代理顾问机构股东服务公司（Institutional Shareholder Services）周二表示，派拉蒙全球公司的股东应投票反对四名董事连任董事会成员，其中包括该媒体公司的董事长莎莉-雷德斯通（Shari Redstone）。【原文：Proxy adviser Institutional Shareholder Services said on Tuesday Paramount Global shareholders should vote against the re-election of four directors to the board, including the media company's chair Shari Redstone.】

item.title: 保德信金融公司旗下 PGIM 将并入价值 1 万亿美元的信贷平台
item.description: 保险公司保德信金融公司（Prudential Financial）的投资管理部门 PGIM 的发言人周二表示，该公司将合并其固定收益部门和私人信贷部门，创建一个近 1 万亿美元的信贷平台。【原文：PGIM, the investment management arm of insurer Prudential Financial , will combine its fixed income and private credit units to create a nearly $1 trillion credit platform, a company spokesperson said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 亚马逊 Prime Video 将于今年秋季在美国推出 Wonder Project 信仰频道
item.description: 基于信仰的内容制作商 Wonder Project 周二表示，它将于今年秋季在美国亚马逊的 Prime Video 上推出一个新的流媒体频道。【原文：Faith-based content producer Wonder Project said on Tuesday it will launch a new streaming channel on Amazon's Prime Video in the United States this fall.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Polymarket 接近 2 亿美元融资，估值超过 10 亿美元
item.description: 一位熟知内情的人士周二告诉路透社，Polymarket即将在一轮融资中筹集到2亿美元资金，对全球最大预测市场的估值将超过10亿美元。【原文：Polymarket is close to raising $200 million in a funding round that values the world's biggest prediction market at more than $1 billion, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月消费者信心指数下降
item.description: 由于家庭对未来六个月的商业状况和就业前景感到担忧，6 月份美国消费者信心意外下降。【原文：U.S. consumer confidence unexpectedly deteriorated in June as households worried about business conditions and employment prospects over the next six months.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，优步支持的电动自行车初创公司 Lime 已为美国 IPO 聘请银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）支持、运营电动自行车和滑板车网络的初创公司 Lime 已聘请投资银行帮助其筹备期待已久的美国首次公开募股。【原文：Lime, a startup backed by Uber Technologies that operates an electric bike and scooter network, has hired investment banks to help it prepare for a long-awaited U.S. initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国和欧洲航空公司股价因以色列与伊朗停战的希望而上涨
item.description: 周二，美国和欧洲的航空公司股价上涨，而油价则因预期以色列和伊朗之间的停火协议将得以维持而下跌。【原文：Shares of U.S. and European airlines rose on Tuesday, while oil prices declined on expectations that a ceasefire between Israel and Iran would hold.】

item.title: 普京授权创建国家信息应用程序，以打击 WhatsApp 和 Telegram
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）周二签署了一项法律，授权开发一款由国家支持、与政府服务相结合的信息应用程序，莫斯科正努力减少对 WhatsApp 和 Telegram 等平台的依赖。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday signed a law authorising the development of a state-backed messaging app integrated with government services, as Moscow strives to reduce its dependence on platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram.】

item.title: Anthropic 在作者版权诉讼中赢得有关人工智能的关键裁决
item.description: 旧金山的一名联邦法官周一晚些时候裁定，根据美国版权法，Anthropic公司未经许可使用书籍训练其人工智能系统是合法的。【原文：A federal judge in San Francisco ruled late Monday that Anthropic's use of books without permission to train its artificial intelligence system was legal under U.S. copyright law.】

item.title: 曾主导在线招聘网站的 CareerBuilder + Monster 申请破产
item.description: 曾经主导在线招聘行业的 CareerBuilder + Monster 周二申请破产保护，并表示计划出售旗下业务。【原文：CareerBuilder + Monster, which once dominated the online recruitment industry, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Tuesday and said it plans to sell its businesses.】

item.title: 邮轮需求稳定，嘉年华上调年度利润目标
item.description: 嘉年华集团（Carnival Corp）周二上调了年度盈利预期，第二季度营收超过预期，原因是预订前往加勒比海和地中海等目的地游轮的游客需求强劲。【原文：Carnival Corp , raised its annual profit forecast after beating second-quarter revenue estimates on Tuesday driven by resilient demand from travelers booking cruises to destinations including the Caribbean and Mediterranean.】

item.title: 美国第一季度经常账户创历史新高
item.description: 第一季度，美国经常账户赤字扩大，创下历史新高，原因是企业为避免唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收高额关税而提前进口。【原文：The U.S. current account deficit widened to a record high in the first quarter as businesses front-loaded imports to avoid President Donald Trump's hefty tariffs on imported goods.】

item.title: 美联储主席哈马克认为近期无需降息
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周二表示，她认为在贸易关税对通胀的影响仍存在很大不确定性的情况下，没有迫切需要降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said Tuesday she sees no pressing need to cut interest rates when there’s still a lot of uncertainty what trade tariffs will do to inflation, which is still above the central bank’suncertainty what“Given the resilience of the economy thus far, the risks from maintaining the current policy setting appear low, and I don’t see a weakening in the economy that would merit imminent rate cuts, though I remain attentive to that possibility,” Hammack said in the text of a speech to be delivered in London.】
